title: Dietmar Hamann criticises Jurgen Klopp's decision not to sign a left-back as he reveals his biggest Liverpool worry
text:

Dietmar Hamann has questioned Jurgen Klopp's decision not to sign a left-back this January as he revealed his biggest worry for Liverpool. 
The Reds legend was discussing his former club's plummeting form, which has seen them win one of their last ten fixtures, on BBC's Match of the Day. 
In the above video, Hamann gives his thoughts on where things are going wrong for Liverpool, focusing on their midfield as a major area of concern. 
He also criticises the manager's decision not to sign an adequate replacement for Alberto Moreno, saying that although James Milner is doing a good job he is not the solution. Dietmar Hamann revealed his biggest worry for Liverpool (Photo: BBC Match of the Day) 
Liverpool were beaten 2-0 by Hull City on Saturday, with goals coming from Alfred N'Diaye and Oumar Niasse in either side of the break. 
Klopp's men are now 13 points behind Premier League leaders Chelsea, who beat Arsenal 3-1 at the Emirates Stadium on the same day. 
Reflecting on his former team after the game, Hamann said: "My biggest worry with Liverpool is I think they are too weak, too soft in centre midfield, I think they need a holding midfielder. Hamann questioned Klopp's decision not to sign a left-back this January (Photo: Gareth Copley) Liverpool have won one of their last ten games in all competitions (Photo: Alex Livesey) 
"I watched them against Chelsea and they have two proper players in [N'Golo] Kante and [Nemanja] Matic. 
"And in Liverpool I don't see enough purpose, I don't see enough structure and this is why they are in the position they are in at the moment." poll loading Did Liverpool have a good transfer window? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
